citation.article-title: Fermentation of 2,3-butanediol by Pelobacter carbinolicus sp. nov. and Pelobacter propionicus sp. nov., and evidence for propionate formation from C2-compounds.

p.s: Description of Pelobacter carbinolicus sp. nov.
Pelobacter carbinolicus (car. bi. no' li. cus M. L. adj. referring to carbinols syn. alcohols; carbinolicus metabolizing alcohols)
Rod-shaped cells, 0.5-0.7 x 1.2-3.0 μm, with rounded ends, single, in pairs or in chains.
2.3-Butanediol, acetoin and ethylene glycol utilized for growth and fermented to acetate and ethanol.
In coculture with hydrogen-consuming bacteria, ethanol, propanol, and butanol are oxidized to the respective fatty acids and hydrogen.
Grows in freshwater medium as well as in the presence of 2% salt.
Sulfate, sulfur, thiosulfate, sulfite, or nitrate not reduced.
Indole not formed, gelatin or urea not hydrolyzed.
Selective enrichment from marine sediments in NaCl-containing mineral media with butanediol or acetoin as sole substrate.
Habitats: anoxic muds of marine origin.
Type strain: Gra Bd 1, DSM 2380, deposited in Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Göttingen.
